017package org.microbean.qualifier;
018
019import java.lang.constant.ClassDesc;
020import java.lang.constant.Constable;
021import java.lang.constant.ConstantDesc;
022import java.lang.constant.DirectMethodHandleDesc;
023import java.lang.constant.DynamicConstantDesc;
024import java.lang.constant.MethodHandleDesc;
025import java.lang.constant.MethodTypeDesc;
026
027import java.util.Arrays;
028import java.util.Collection;
029import java.util.HashSet;
030import java.util.Iterator;
031import java.util.Map;
032import java.util.Map.Entry;
033import java.util.Optional;
034import java.util.Set;
035import java.util.TreeMap;
036
037import java.util.function.Function;
038import java.util.function.Predicate;
039
040import static java.lang.constant.ConstantDescs.BSM_INVOKE;
041import static java.lang.constant.ConstantDescs.DEFAULT_NAME;
042import static java.lang.constant.ConstantDescs.NULL;
043import static java.lang.constant.DirectMethodHandleDesc.Kind.STATIC;
044
045import static java.util.Collections.emptySortedMap;
046import static java.util.Collections.unmodifiableSortedMap;
047
048import static org.microbean.qualifier.ConstantDescs.CD_Constable;
049import static org.microbean.qualifier.ConstantDescs.CD_Qualifiers;
050
051/**
052 * A {@link Constable}, immutable set of
053 * key-value pairs that can be used to further qualify an object for
054 * many different purposes.
055 *
056 * <p>This is a <a
057 * href="https://docs.oracle.com/en/java/javase/17/docs/api/java.base/java/lang/doc-files/ValueBased.html">value-based
058 * class</a>.</p>
059 *
060 * <p>Values of type {@code K} must be members of classes adhering to
061 * <a
062 * href="https://docs.oracle.com/en/java/javase/17/docs/api/java.base/java/lang/doc-files/ValueBased.html">value-based
063 * semantics</a>.</p>
064 *
065 * <p>Values of type {@code V} must be members of classes adhering to
066 * <a
067 * href="https://docs.oracle.com/en/java/javase/17/docs/api/java.base/java/lang/doc-files/ValueBased.html">value-based
068 * semantics</a>.</p>
069 *
070 * <p>Undefined behavior will result if the preceding requirements are
071 * not honored.</p>
072 *
073 * @param <K> the type borne by the keys of the qualifiers in this
074 * {@link Qualifiers}
075 *
076 * @param <V> the type borne by the values of the qualifiers in this
077 * {@link Qualifiers}
078 *
079 * @param qualifiers a {@link Map} representing the qualifiers; may be
080 * {@code null} in which case an {@linkplain Map#isEmpty() empty
081 * <code>Map</code>} will be used instead
082 *
083 * @author <a href="https://about.me/lairdnelson"
084 * target="_parent">Laird Nelson</a>
085 *
086 * @see #of(Constable, Constable)
087 */
088public final record Qualifiers<K extends Constable & Comparable<K>, V extends Constable>(Map<K, V> qualifiers) implements Constable {
089
090
091  /*
092   * Static fields.
093   */
094
095
096  private static final Qualifiers<?, ?> EMPTY_QUALIFIERS = new Qualifiers<>();
097
098
099  /*
100   * Constructors.
101   */
102
103
104  /**
105   * Creates a new {@linkplain Map#isEmpty() empty} {@link Qualifiers}.
106   */
107  public Qualifiers() {
108    this(null);
109  }
110
111  /**
112   * Creates a new {@link Qualifiers}.
113   *
114   * @param qualifiers a {@link Map} representing the qualifiers; may be
115   * {@code null} in which case an {@linkplain Map#isEmpty() empty
116   * <code>Map</code>} will be used instead
117   */
118  public Qualifiers {
119    if (qualifiers == null || qualifiers.isEmpty()) {
120      qualifiers = emptySortedMap();
121    } else {
122      qualifiers = unmodifiableSortedMap(new TreeMap<>(qualifiers));
123    }
124  }
125
126
127  /*
128   * Instance methods.
129   */
130
131
132  /**
133   * Returns {@code true} if this {@link Qualifiers} logically
134   * contains the supplied {@link Qualifiers}.
135   *
136   * <p>A {@link Qualifiers} is said to contain another {@link
137   * Qualifiers} if either:</p>
138   *
139   * <ul>
140   *
141   * <li>the two {@link Qualifiers} instances are identical, or</li>
142   *
143   * <li>the {@linkplain Map#size() size} of the first {@link Qualifiers}
144   * is greater than the {@linkplain Map#size() size} of the second
145   * {@link Qualifiers}, and the {@linkplain Map#entrySet() entry set}
146   * of this {@link Qualifiers} {@linkplain
147   * Set#containsAll(java.util.Collection) contains all} of the
148   * entries in the second {@link Qualifiers}' {@linkplain
149   * Map#entrySet() entry set}</li>
150   *
151   * </ul>
152   *
153   * @param other the {@link Qualifiers} to test; must not be {@code
154   * null}
155   *
156   * @return {@code true} if this {@link Qualifiers} logically
157   * contains the supplied {@link Qualifiers}
158   *
159   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code other} is {@code null}
160   *
161   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
162   *
163   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
164   * threads.
165   *
166   * @see Map#size()
167   *
168   * @see Set#containsAll(java.util.Collection)
169   */
170  public final boolean contains(final Qualifiers<?, ?> other) {
171    return this == other || this.qualifiers().size() >= other.qualifiers().size() && this.qualifiers().entrySet().containsAll(other.qualifiers().entrySet());
172  }
173
174  /**
175   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link Qualifiers} is a
176   * subset of the supplied {@link Qualifiers}.
177   *
178   * @param other the other {@link Qualifiers}; must not be {@code
179   * null}
180   *
181   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link Qualifiers} is a
182   * subset of the supplied {@link Qualifiers}
183   *
184   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code other} is {@code null}
185   *
186   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
187   *
188   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
189   * threads.
190   */
191  public final boolean isSubsetOf(final Qualifiers<?, ?> other) {
192    return other == this || other.contains(this);
193  }
194
195  /**
196   * Returns the number of entries this {@link Qualifiers} has in
197   * common with the supplied {@link Qualifiers}.
198   *
199   * <p>The number returned will be {@code 0} or greater.</p>
200   *
201   * @param other the other {@link Qualifiers}; may be {@code null} in
202   * which case {@code 0} will be returned
203   *
204   * @return the number of entries this {@link Qualifiers} has in
205   * common with the supplied {@link Qualifiers}
206   *
207   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
208   *
209   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
210   * threads.
211   */
212  public final int intersectionSize(final Qualifiers<?, ?> other) {
213    if (other == this) {
214      // Just an identity check to rule this easy case out.
215      return this.qualifiers().size();
216    } else if (other == null || other.qualifiers().isEmpty()) {
217      return 0;
218    } else {
219      final Collection<? extends Entry<?, ?>> otherEntrySet = other.qualifiers().entrySet();
220      return (int)this.qualifiers().entrySet()
221        .stream()
222        .filter(otherEntrySet::contains)
223        .count();
224    }
225  }
226
227  /**
228   * Returns the size of the <em>symmetric difference</em> between
229   * this {@link Qualifiers} and the supplied {@link Qualifiers}.
230   *
231   * <p>The number returned is always {@code 0} or greater.</p>
232   *
233   * <p>The size of the symmetric difference between two {@link
234   * Qualifiers} instances is the number of qualifier entries that are
235   * in one {@link Qualifiers} instance but not in the other.</p>
236   *
237   * @param other the other {@link Qualifiers} instance; may be {@code
238   * null} in which case the return value of an invocation of this
239   * {@link Qualifiers}' {@link #qualifiers() qualifiers}' {@link
240   * Map#size()} method will be returned
241   *
242   * @return the size of the <em>symmetric difference</em> between
243   * this {@link Qualifiers} and the supplied {@link Qualifiers};
244   * always {@code 0} or greater
245   *
246   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
247   *
248   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
249   * threads.
250   */
251  public final int symmetricDifferenceSize(final Qualifiers<?, ?> other) {
252    if (other == this) {
253      // Just an identity check to rule this easy case out.
254      return 0;
255    } else if (other == null || other.qualifiers.isEmpty()) {
256      return this.qualifiers().size();
257    } else if (this.equals(other)) {
258      return 0;
259    } else {
260      final Collection<Entry<?, ?>> otherSymmetricDifference = new HashSet<>(this.qualifiers().entrySet());
261      other.qualifiers().entrySet().stream()
262        .filter(Predicate.not(otherSymmetricDifference::add))
263        .forEach(otherSymmetricDifference::remove);
264      return otherSymmetricDifference.size();
265    }
266  }
267
268  /**
269   * Returns an {@link Optional} containing a {@link ConstantDesc}
270   * representing this {@link Qualifiers}.
271   *
272   * @return an {@link Optional} containing a {@link ConstantDesc}
273   * representing this {@link Qualifiers}; never {@code null}; never
274   * {@linkplain Optional#isEmpty() empty}
275   *
276   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
277   *
278   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
279   *
280   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
281   * threads.
282   */
283  @Override // Constable
284  public final Optional<? extends ConstantDesc> describeConstable() {
285    final Collection<Entry<K, V>> entrySet = this.qualifiers().entrySet();
286    if (entrySet.isEmpty()) {
287      return
288        Optional.of(DynamicConstantDesc.ofNamed(BSM_INVOKE,
289                                                DEFAULT_NAME,
290                                                CD_Qualifiers,
291                                                MethodHandleDesc.ofMethod(STATIC,
292                                                                          CD_Qualifiers,
293                                                                          "of",
294                                                                          MethodTypeDesc.of(CD_Qualifiers))));
295    } else {
296      final int bsmInvokeArgumentsLength = 2 * entrySet.size() + 1;
297      final ConstantDesc[] bsmInvokeArguments = new ConstantDesc[bsmInvokeArgumentsLength];
298      bsmInvokeArguments[0] =
299        MethodHandleDesc.ofMethod(STATIC,
300                                  CD_Qualifiers,
301                                  "of",
302                                  MethodTypeDesc.of(CD_Qualifiers,
303                                                    CD_Constable.arrayType()));
304      int i = 1;
305      for (final Entry<K, V> entry : entrySet) {
306        final Constable key = entry.getKey();
307        final ConstantDesc k = key == null ? null : key.describeConstable().orElse(null);
308        if (k == null) {
309          return Optional.empty();
310        }
311        bsmInvokeArguments[i++] = k;
312        final Constable value = entry.getValue();
313        final ConstantDesc v = value == null ? NULL : value.describeConstable().orElse(null);
314        if (v == null) {
315          return Optional.empty();
316        }
317        bsmInvokeArguments[i++] = v;
318      }
319      return Optional.of(DynamicConstantDesc.ofNamed(BSM_INVOKE,
320                                                     DEFAULT_NAME,
321                                                     CD_Qualifiers,
322                                                     bsmInvokeArguments));
323    }
324  }
325
326  /**
327   * Returns a <strong>new</strong> {@link Qualifiers} whose keys are
328   * produced by the supplied {@link Function}, which is expected to
329   * prepend a prefix to the original key and return the result.
330   *
331   * @param <K2> the type borne by the new keys
332   *
333   * @param f a non-{@code null}, deterministic, idempotent {@link
334   * Function} that accepts keys drawn from this {@link Qualifiers}'
335   * {@linkplain Map#entrySet() entry set} and returns a non-{@code
336   * null} prefixed version of that key; must not be {@code null}
337   *
338   * @return a <strong>new</strong> {@link Qualifiers} whose keys have
339   * been prefixed by the actions of the supplied {@link Function}
340   *
341   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code f} is {@code null}
342   *
343   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
344   *
345   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic,
346   * assuming the supplied {@link Function} is.
347   *
348   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
349   * threads, assuming the supplied {@link Function} is
350   */
351  public final <K2 extends Constable & Comparable<K2>> Qualifiers<K2, V> withPrefix(final Function<? super K, ? extends K2> f) {
352    final Map<K2, V> map = new TreeMap<>();
353    for (final Entry<? extends K, ? extends V> entry : this.qualifiers().entrySet()) {
354      map.put(f.apply(entry.getKey()), entry.getValue());
355    }
356    return new Qualifiers<>(map);
357  }
358
359
360  /*
361   * Static methods.
362   */
363
364
365  /**
366   * Returns a {@link Qualifiers} whose {@link #qualifiers()} method
367   * returns an {@linkplain Map#isEmpty() empty <code>Map</code>}.
368   *
369   * @param <K> the type borne by the keys of the qualifiers in the
370   * returned {@link Qualifiers} (somewhat moot since the returned
371   * {@link Qualifiers} will be empty)
372   *
373   * @param <V> the type borne by the values of the qualifiers in the
374   * returned {@link Qualifiers} (somewhat moot since the returned
375   * {@link Qualifiers} will be empty)
376   *
377   * @return a {@link Qualifiers} whose {@link #qualifiers()} method
378   * returns an {@linkplain Map#isEmpty() empty <code>Map</code>}
379   *
380   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
381   *
382   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
383   *
384   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
385   * threads.
386   */
387  // Used by #describeConstable()
388  @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
389  public static final <K extends Constable & Comparable<K>, V extends Constable> Qualifiers<K, V> of() {
390    return (Qualifiers<K, V>)EMPTY_QUALIFIERS;
391  }
392
393  /**
394   * Returns a {@link Qualifiers} equal to one consisting of the
395   * entries represented by the supplied {@link Map}.
396   *
397   * @param <K> the type borne by the keys of the qualifiers in the
398   * returned {@link Qualifiers}
399   *
400   * @param <V> the type borne by the values of the qualifiers in the
401   * returned {@link Qualifiers}
402   *
403   * @param map the {@link Map} of qualifier names and values; may be
404   * {@code null} in which case the return value of the {@link #of()}
405   * method will be returned
406   *
407   * @return a {@link Qualifiers} equal to one consisting of the
408   * entries represented by the supplied {@link Map}
409   *
410   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
411   *
412   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
413   *
414   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
415   * threads.
416   *
417   * @see #of(Constable, Constable)
418   */
419  @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
420  public static final <K extends Constable & Comparable<K>, V extends Constable> Qualifiers<K, V> of(final Map<? extends K, ? extends V> map) {
421    if (map == null || map.isEmpty()) {
422      return of();
423    } else {
424      return new Qualifiers<>((Map<K, V>)map);
425    }
426  }
427
428  /**
429   * Returns a new {@link Qualifiers} with a single qualifier whose
430   * name is the supplied {@code name0} argument, and whose value is
431   * the supplied {@code value0} argument.
432   *
433   * @param <K> the type borne by the keys of the qualifiers in the
434   * returned {@link Qualifiers}
435   *
436   * @param <V> the type borne by the values of the qualifiers in the
437   * returned {@link Qualifiers}
438   *
439   * @param name0 the qualifier name; must not be {@code null}
440   *
441   * @param value0 the new value; must not be {@code null}
442   *
443   * @return a new {@link Qualifiers} with a single qualifier whose
444   * name is the supplied {@code name0} argument, and whose value is
445   * the supplied {@code value0} argument
446   *
447   * @exception NullPointerException if either {@code name0} or {@code
448   * value0} is {@code null}
449   *
450   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
451   *
452   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
453   *
454   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
455   * threads.
456   */
457  public static final <K extends Constable & Comparable<K>, V extends Constable> Qualifiers<K, V> of(final K name0, final V value0) {
458    return new Qualifiers<>(Map.of(name0, value0));
459  }
460
461  /**
462   * Returns a {@link Qualifiers} consisting of the entries
463   * represented by the supplied alternating name-value pairs.
464   *
465   * @param <K> the type borne by the keys of the qualifiers in the
466   * returned {@link Qualifiers}
467   *
468   * @param <V> the type borne by the values of the qualifiers in the
469   * returned {@link Qualifiers}
470   *
471   * @param name0 a qualifier name; must not be {@code null}
472   *
473   * @param value0 the qualifier value corresponding to the
474   * immediately preceding qualifier name; must not be {@code null}
475   *
476   * @param name1 a qualifier name; must not be {@code null}
477   *
478   * @param value1 the qualifier value corresponding to the
479   * immediately preceding qualifier name; must not be {@code null}
480   *
481   * @return a {@link Qualifiers} consisting of the entries
482   * represented by the supplied alternating name-value pairs
483   *
484   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
485   *
486   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
487   *
488   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
489   * threads.
490   */
491  public static final <K extends Constable & Comparable<K>, V extends Constable> Qualifiers<K, V> of(final K name0, final V value0,
492                                                                                                     final K name1, final V value1) {
493    return new Qualifiers<>(Map.of(name0, value0, name1, value1));
494  }
495
496  /**
497   * Returns a {@link Qualifiers} consisting of the entries
498   * represented by the supplied alternating name-value pairs.
499   *
500   * @param <K> the type borne by the keys of the qualifiers in the
501   * returned {@link Qualifiers}
502   *
503   * @param <V> the type borne by the values of the qualifiers in the
504   * returned {@link Qualifiers}
505   *
506   * @param name0 a qualifier name; must not be {@code null}
507   *
508   * @param value0 the qualifier value corresponding to the
509   * immediately preceding qualifier name; must not be {@code null}
510   *
511   * @param name1 a qualifier name; must not be {@code null}
512   *
513   * @param value1 the qualifier value corresponding to the
514   * immediately preceding qualifier name; must not be {@code null}
515   *
516   * @param name2 a qualifier name; must not be {@code null}
517   *
518   * @param value2 the qualifier value corresponding to the
519   * immediately preceding qualifier name; must not be {@code null}
520   *
521   * @return a {@link Qualifiers} consisting of the entries
522   * represented by the supplied alternating name-value pairs
523   *
524   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
525   *
526   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
527   *
528   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
529   * threads.
530   */
531  public static final <K extends Constable & Comparable<K>, V extends Constable> Qualifiers<K, V> of(final K name0, final V value0,
532                                                                                                     final K name1, final V value1,
533                                                                                                     final K name2, final V value2) {
534    return new Qualifiers<>(Map.of(name0, value0, name1, value1, name2, value2));
535  }
536
537  /**
538   * Returns a {@link Qualifiers} consisting of the entries
539   * represented by the supplied alternating name-value pairs.
540   *
541   * <p>The supplied {@code nameValuePairs} must be an even-numbered
542   * array of non-{@code null} {@link Constable} instances, where the
543   * zero-based even-numbered elements are {@link String}s represents
544   * qualifier names, and the zero-based odd-numbered {@link
545   * Constable} elements represent qualifier values.</p>
546   *
547   * @param <K> the type borne by the keys of the qualifiers in the
548   * returned {@link Qualifiers}
549   *
550   * @param <V> the type borne by the values of the qualifiers in the
551   * returned {@link Qualifiers}
552   *
553   * @param nameValuePairs the name-value pairs as described above;
554   * may be {@code null} in which case the return value of the {@link
555   * #of()} method will be returned
556   *
557   * @return a {@link Qualifiers} consisting of the entries
558   * represented by the supplied alternating name-value pairs
559   *
560   * @exception IllegalArgumentException if an even number of
561   * arguments is not supplied
562   *
563   * @exception ClassCastException if elements in the supplied array
564   * at even positions ({@code 0}, {@code 2}, {@code 4}…) are not of
565   * type {@code K}
566   *
567   * @exception NullPointerException if any argument is {@code null}
568   *
569   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
570   *
571   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
572   *
573   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
574   * threads.
575   */
576  // Used by #describeConstable()
577  @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
578  public static final <K extends Constable & Comparable<K>, V extends Constable> Qualifiers<K, V> of(final Constable... nameValuePairs) {
579    if (nameValuePairs == null || nameValuePairs.length <= 0) {
580      return of();
581    } else if (nameValuePairs.length % 2 != 0) {
582      throw new IllegalArgumentException("nameValuePairs: " + Arrays.toString(nameValuePairs));
583    } else {
584      final Map<K, V> map = new TreeMap<>();
585      for (int i = 0; i < nameValuePairs.length; i++) {
586        map.put((K)nameValuePairs[i++], (V)nameValuePairs[i]);
587      }
588      return new Qualifiers<>(map);
589    }
590  }
591
592}
